rundown: 3-4 L vs Washington Nationals Bryce Elder: 7.0 innings, 3 earned runs, 6 hits, 2 HR, 7 strikeouts Batters: Drake Baldwin (1 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Eli White (1 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Marcell Ozuna (1 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves fell short in a close game against the Washington Nationals, losing by a single run. Despite a solid performance from Bryce Elder on the mound, the team could not overcome the Nationals' offensive efforts. Key highlights include: 1. Bryce Elder struck out 7 batters, showcasing his ability to dominate at times. 2. The Braves hit three home runs, one each from Drake Baldwin, Eli White, and Marcell Ozuna, contributing to their scoring. 3. The Nationals managed to out-hit the Braves 9 to 6, which ultimately made the difference in the game.
